intro: Gutierrezia taltalensis, commonly known as Taltal goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is adapted to harsh desert conditions, featuring small, yellowish flowers and silver-gray foliage to reduce water loss. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland desert ecosystems. Gutierrezia taltalensis plays a role in local biodiversity and is of interest for its potential in ecological restoration projects.
